p: The azido polymer ( 3) was dissolved in water followed by the addition of 7 (3 mg, 1.3 equiv). CuSO 4·5H 2O (0.1 equiv) and sodium l-ascorbate (0.3 equiv) were dissolved in water separately and added to the reaction mixture. The reaction was carried out at 100 °C with microwave radiation for 60 min. The solvent was evaporated, and the crude reaction mixture was purified by dialysis using a cellulose based dialysis cassette (MWCO: 2K) against deionized water for 3–4 days and freeze-dried to give a white compound (3 mg, 24%). The disappearance of the azide stretching peak in the IR spectra of the final compound confirmed that all of the azido groups had reacted.
